entry.title: Calculate An Arithmetic Expression
entry.content:
CALCULATE AN ARITHMETIC EXPRESS

  • Hello guys, have you ever heard of “Stack” and “Queue” before? They’re basic data structure. Like an array and a linked list, Stack and Queue is a basic data structure that holds a sequence of elements.

  • However, they’re still different from array, linked list and each of them about mechanism of action:

    • Stack: stores and retrives items in a last-in-first-out manner(LIFO). That means: the last item inserted in stack is the first one retrive. Simple applications: convert to another counting system, check a sequence of parentheses, …

    • Queue: stores anf retrives items in a first-in-first-out manner(FIFO). That means: abcxyz, … oh I’m lazy …

  • “Stack” and “Queue” are helpful data structure, support us handling data.

  • Recently, I’ve found a interesting application of “Stack” and “Queue”, calculate a arithmetic express using “Balan” algorithm.

  • About “Balan” algorithm, I won’t concern with it, because you can search GG, key word is “Reverse Polish notation”, I will just give you how to find result through source code.

  1. Procedure:
* Initialize a stack stores operands, a queue stores digits.

* Enter the express through a string chain.

* Parsing the chain into a digit, a operand, a parentheses. 

* Initialize the second stack calculates express.
  1. Source code:
  • Finally, let’s check it out !

HEHE, GOOGBYE !

entry.title: Exhaustive Algorithm
entry.content:
EXHAUSTIVE ALGORITHM

  • Hello everyone, “Data structure and algorithm” is an important subject in college. It includes a lots things about algorithm, …, and exhaustive algorithm is one of all.

  • An exhaustive algorithm is one that finds a best combination of items by looking all the posible combination.

  • Recursion is helpful if you need to examine many posible combination and identify the best combination.

  • Problem: How many different ways you can make change for 7,700 VND(by coins) using our system of coins?
    • Ex: 7,700 = 5,000 + 2,000 + 500 + 200 = 5,000 + 1,000 + 1,000 + 500 + 200 = …

  • Your task: Find the number of posible combination and the best combination.

  • Procedure:

    1. Initialize coinPos mark the coin value we used.

    2. coinsUsed[] is a array stores the used coins.

    3. Make a call to recursive function with amount subtract to coinsValue[coinPos].

    4. If amount equal to 0, store all the used coins in coinsUsed[] into bestCoins[], assign numBestCoins by numCoinsUsed.

    5. If amount is negative, return( reject this combination).

    6. Repeat untill coinsLeft equal to zero.

  • Here is code:

Cre: Starting out with C++(Eight edition) - Tony Gaddis

entry.title: Simple Snake Game
entry.content:
Simple SNAKE Game

Long time no C … guys ^^.

The whole world is shaking with Corona. nCov is very scary, right? But I’m in long vacation because of it, so thanks so much, nCoV.

Because of all my day is waste, I’m back with a new … hmmm … very very simple project.

There are two common programming methods in practice today: procedural programming and object-oriented programming(OOP).

Today, I’m going to show you how to write a familiar game, Snake eats fruit (with OOP).

Requests: A brief understanding of classes, objects, …, OOP in general.

  1. Design:
  • Our game’s having 5 classes: Snake(main program), Fruit, Setting, Score, Menu.
  1. Beginning:

* Notice: * In this program, I used some graphic function in header file “Graphic.h” * This program I wrote in Window 7.

  • “Setting” class:

  • This class’s managing data about Snake game’s parameter such as : console’s width, height, snake’s speed, speed increase, level, the status of the game.

  • Accessor methods: GetWidth(), GetHeight(), GetLevel(), GetSpeedSnake().

  • Mutator methods: EndGame(), UpradeLevel(), DrawLevel().

  • Here is code:

  • "”Point” class:
  • “Fruit” class:
  • “Score” class:
  • “Snake” class: Main class
  • Idea: We’re saving the location of each Snake’s cell into pointer array.
  • “Menu” class: Make a menu to “make color” a bit :))))

  • Main program:

  • Let’s play game ^^

Hmmm … We’ve completed a quiet simple and familiar console game. If you want to check the source code, you can vist MySimpleSnake

Hope you will enjoy, Goodbye ^^
entry.summary: Simple SNAKE Game Long time no C … guys ^^.

entry.title: A simple way to parse a website

entry.content:
The first time I’ve parsed a website

Early, I found it diffucult to parse a website because I didn't know how to do it right. After a while of searching GG and Youtube, I realized that bs4 module can help me.
  • Conditions: Python3.x, a little understanding of HTML, working with file .csv, … brain :v

OK, let’s get started!

  • First, import some libraries can help us with parsing our website:
  • Get the URL of your website you want to parse and make a request( Remember to close it :v):
  • Now, we’re going to take the information of the laptops:
  • Make a file .csv to store the info of each laptop:
  • Last, we’re going to check the result in “ngu.csv” file ^^

entry.title: How to build a Christmas Tree

link.title: How to build a Christmas Tree

entry.content:
MAKE A CHRISTMAS TREE IN PYTHON

1.IDEA: We will use a main loop that looping the tree with some colored-dots after a few seconnds. After each loop, the colored-dots get on/off such as: red->none, blue->none, …, by using the Threading module.

1.Implement:

  • Take a Christmas tree picture in ASCII code, put it into file “ChristmasTree.txt”. Changing some characters into R, G, Y or B( equivalent to red, green, yellow and blue).

  • Import some module necessary

  • Reading the file into a list:
  • Looping the list and save the index of the colored-dots:
  • We continue to build 2 functions for change the colour of the colored-dots and looping the on/off:
  • Now, we have the main function to loop the tree, we continue to set up 4 thread of Red, Green, Yellow, Blue, run in parallel:
  • Take a lock and release it when draw new screen:
  • Last, full of program:
